description: Numbers that are the sum of 2 nonzero squares in exactly 2 ways.
comments: Order and signs don't count. E.g. 50 = 5^2+5^2 = 7^2+1^2 (= (-5)^2+5^2, but that doesn't count as different).A131574 is a subsequence. - _Zak Seidov_, Jan 31 2014A025426(a(n)) = 2. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 26 2015
links: Vincenzo Librandi, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Square Number.
Index entries for sequences related to sums of squares
mathematica: selQ[n_] := Length[ Select[ PowersRepresentations[n, 2, 2], Times @@ # != 0 &]] == 2; Select[Range[1000], selQ] (* _Jean-Fran√ßois Alcover_, Oct 03 2013 *)
prog: (Haskell)a025285 n = a025285_list !! (n-1)a025285_list = filter ((== 2) . a025426) [1..]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Feb 26 2015
author: _David W. Wilson_
